title.narrative: EFFECTIVE IMPLEMENTATION OF CSSP

description.narrative: By 2021, the Ministry of Social Development and Human Security and other lines ministries have enhanced capacity to effectively implement and monitor the provision of child-sensitive social protection for children (e.g. child support grant, disability grant, grant for poor students and others), which contributes to Access To Inclusive Social Protection, Social Protection And Child Poverty. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Data, Research, Evaluation And Knowledge Management, Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Cross sectoral - Operational costs

participating-org.narrative: FACULTY OF SOCIAL ADMINISTRATION THAMMASAT UNIVERSITY

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2021, the Ministry of Social Development and Human Security and other lines ministries have enhanced capacity to effectivelyimplement and monitor the provision of child-sensitive social protection for children (e.g. child support grant, disability grant,grant for poor students and others)

description.narrative: In 2021, enhanced accountabilities, work processes, and vertical integration of the Child Support Grant (CSG) was achieved with support to the design, implementation, quality assurance and capacity building for an improved version of the CSG;Management Information System (currently 2.3 million beneficiaries). Additionally, the outreach and access to key child-sensitive social protection schemes were enabled thanks to effective communication strategies of the CSG and Disability Grant | Status:On-track | As-of Date:30/01/2022

title.narrative: Extent to which policies for monitoring and implementation of other SP policies for children have been improved Level 0: Assessment of at least two additional social protection policies in terms of design and implementation conducted Level 1: Draft revisi, Text

Extent to which the CSG is effectively monitored Level 1: Assessment of the CSG monitoring system completed and draft revisions in place Level 2: Policy and operational guidelines revised to accommodate adjustments suggested by the assessment Level 3: M, Text
Extent to which Management Information System of the CSG is strengthened, Text
